segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group

segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group

segment.source: How to Create a Connection Group
segment.target: How to Create a Connection Group

segment.source: Use these steps to create a connection group by using the App-V Management Console.
segment.target: Use these steps to create a connection group by using the App-V Management Console.

segment.source: To use PowerShell to create connection groups, see How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: To use PowerShell to create connection groups, see How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: When you place packages in a connection group, their package root paths are merged.
segment.target: When you place packages in a connection group, their package root paths are merged.

segment.source: If you remove packages, only the remaining packages maintain the merged root.
segment.target: If you remove packages, only the remaining packages maintain the merged root.

segment.source: To create a connection group
segment.target: To create a connection group

segment.source: In the App-V 5.1 Management Console, select CONNECTION GROUPS to display the Connection Groups library.
segment.target: In the App-V 5.1 Management Console, select CONNECTION GROUPS to display the Connection Groups library.

segment.source: Select ADD CONNECTION GROUP to create a new connection group.
segment.target: Select ADD CONNECTION GROUP to create a new connection group.

segment.source: In the New Connection Group pane, type a description for the group.
segment.target: In the New Connection Group pane, type a description for the group.

segment.source: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane to add a new application to the connection group.
segment.target: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane to add a new application to the connection group.

segment.source: In the PACKAGES Entire Library pane, select the application to be added, and click the arrow to add the application.
segment.target: In the PACKAGES Entire Library pane, select the application to be added, and click the arrow to add the application.

segment.source: To remove an application, select the application to be removed in the PACKAGES IN pane and click the arrow.
segment.target: To remove an application, select the application to be removed in the PACKAGES IN pane and click the arrow.

segment.source: To reprioritize the applications in your connection group, use the arrows in the PACKAGES IN pane.
segment.target: To reprioritize the applications in your connection group, use the arrows in the PACKAGES IN pane.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: By default, the Active Directory Domain Services access configurations that are associated with a specific application are not added to the connection group.
segment.target: By default, the Active Directory Domain Services access configurations that are associated with a specific application are not added to the connection group.

segment.source: To transfer the Active Directory access configuration, select ADD PACKAGE ACCESS TO GROUP ACCESS, which is located in the PACKAGES IN pane.
segment.target: To transfer the Active Directory access configuration, select ADD PACKAGE ACCESS TO GROUP ACCESS, which is located in the PACKAGES IN pane.

segment.source: After adding all the applications and configuring Active Directory access, click Apply.
segment.target: After adding all the applications and configuring Active Directory access, click Apply.
